org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.requests

Class SyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.requests.SyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE_TYPE - The type of response value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppBase.SyncBladeRequest, BladeBase.SyncBladeRequest, IncDesImpl.SyncBladeRequest

    public abstract class SyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    A sync request performs an operation safely within the thread context of the target reactor.

      SyncRequest(Reactor _targetReactor)
      Create a SyncRequest.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE> asRequestImpl()
      Returns the object used to implement the request.
      RESPONSE_TYPE call()
      Passes this request and then blocks the source thread until the request has been returned with a response value.
      Reactor getSourceReactor()
      Returns the source reactor, or null.
      Reactor getTargetReactor()
      Returns the Reactor that provides the thread context in which this request will operate.

      Returns true if the request has been canceled.
      void onCancel()
      An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled.
      void onClose()
      An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed.
      abstract RESPONSE_TYPE processSyncRequest()
      The processSyncRequest method will be invoked by the target Reactor on its own thread when the SyncRequest is dequeued from the target inbox for processing.
      void signal()
      Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back.

        Create a SyncRequest.
        Parameters:
        _targetReactor - The targetReactor where this SyncRequest Objects is passed for processing. The thread owned by this targetReactor will process this SyncRequest.

        Returns:
        The value returned by the target blades.

      • signal

        public void signal()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back. I.E. The signal method results in a 1-way message being passed. If an exception is thrown while processing this Request, that exception is simply logged as a warning.
        Specified by:
        signal in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • call

        public RESPONSE_TYPE call()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Passes this request and then blocks the source thread until the request has been returned with a response value. This method can not be called within the thread context of a reactor.
        Specified by:
        call in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Returns:
        The result value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isCanceled

        public boolean isCanceled()
                   throws ReactorClosedException
        Description copied from interface: Request

        Returns true if the request has been canceled. Closing the source reactor, for example, will result in the request being canceled. This method should ideally be called periodically within long loops.

        A check is also made to see if the request is closed. If processing continues for any length of time after the request is closed, then a hung thread can result and a recovery process is initiated. To avoid this, call isCanceled withing any loops. It will throw an ReactorClosedException if the request is closed.

        Specified by:
        isCanceled in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Returns:
        True if the request has been canceled.
        Throws:
        ReactorClosedException - Thrown when the request is closed.

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onCancel does nothing.
        Specified by:
        onCancel in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>

      • onClose

        public void onClose()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onClose does nothing.
        Specified by:
        onClose in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
